meanings.definition: Not having enough staff to adequately perform tasks.
meanings.sent1: The small restaurant was understaffed, making it hard for the waiters to serve all the customers.
meanings.sent2: The hospital was understaffed, causing delays in patient care.
meanings.sent3: The circus was understaffed, so the clowns had to juggle plates while serving food to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The ship felt understaffed, like a captain without a crew to help navigate through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The understaffed office felt like a busy beehive without enough worker bees to keep up with the workload.

meanings.sent1: The understaffed store struggled to keep up with stocking shelves due to lack of employees.
meanings.sent2: The school was understaffed, leading to larger class sizes and less individual attention for students.
meanings.sent3: The zoo was understaffed, so the monkeys tried to help by handing out bananas to visitors.
meanings.sent4: The team felt understaffed, like a soccer team playing with only half the players on the field.
meanings.sent5: The understaffed factory resembled a clock missing some gears, unable to function smoothly without all its parts.
